content.description: Start on the left side of the yellow wall under the overhang, climb up through pockets and some nice roof pulls to a slopey topout crux.         take in, repulse
content.location: middle/left side of the small overhang

content.description: Start on the left side of the yellow section of the wall before it turns dark gray, under the small overhang. Climb up through pockets to ledges, then top out left.
content.location: left side of the small overhang

content.description: On the left side of the wall where the rock starts to turn dark gray, bash up through some big features to the top.
content.location: left of the small overhang on the left side

content.description: Start up on the skirt on the far right side of the errorzone, climb up into a perfect jug hueco in the roof, then reach out to jugs over the next roof, then more jugs to the top. Perfect stone, fun movement. One of the best easy problems I've ever touched in Central Texas.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hLaGi2oAf5c
content.protection: 3+ pads, the ground drops away and all of a sudden you're up high
content.location: right side of roof, look for the obvious 4" hueco in the low roof

content.description: Very similar to Front Wall, but short enough to boulder. Some easy stuff and definitely potential for hard stuff, but pretty much everything needs to be cleaned and brushed. On the right side of the wall, the ground drops away so the falls get bigger and bigger the higher you climb, bring extra pads.
